When a person or object is being addressed, a special form, called the  vocative, is used. The endings are -e for masculine nouns and -o (or -e) for feminine nouns. Here are examples of the most frequently used vocative forms, those for the  nouns meaning Mr., Mrs. and Miss. Note that the accent changes place in the
vocative of госпожа (госпожо!).
 
 господин / господин-е
 госпожа / госпож-о
 госпожица / госпожиц-е

Most masculine nouns, and practically all feminine nouns, form the plural by adding -и. Masculine nouns add this ending directly to the singular form, while feminine nouns _replace_ the singular ending -a by the ending -и.
 
 студент / студент-и  
 студентка / студентк-и
